subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Orthodox English Character Set to Quickscript Dictionary
msgSnippet: I d like a copy of the whole 10 MB document if you would send it to me. Lee leehickenlooper@mac.com On Wednesday, December 11, 2002, at 08:10  AM, chuck091956
messageBody:
I'd like a copy of the whole 10 MB document if you would send it to me.
Lee
leehickenlooper@...

On Wednesday, December 11, 2002, at 08:10 AM, chuck091956
<chuck091956@...> wrote:

> Hello All,
>
> I just uploaded to the Files section of the web site a "Orthodox
> English Character Set to Quikscript Dictionary" It is only a sample
> of the whole document and is still in draft form. The whole document
> is 10 MB in size and is 1114 pages long.
>
> The sourse for the translations\phonic pronunciations were derived by
> Carnegie Mellon University. It was compiled in a machine-readable
> pronunciation dictionary for standard North American English that
> contains over 125,000 words. The dictionary uses a phoneme set of 39
> phonemes, for which the vowels can carry lexical stress.
>
> Carnegie Mellon University generated this dictionary using the
> following independent sources:
> - a 20k+ general English dictionary, built by hand at Carnegie Mellon
> (extensively proofed and used).
> - a 200k+ UCLA-proofed version of the shoup dictionary.
> - a 32k subset of the Dragon dictionary.
> - a 53k+ dictionary of proper names, synthesiser-generated, unproofed.
> - a 200k dictionary generated with Orator, unproofed.
> - a 200k dictionary generated with Mitalk, unproofed.
>
> Its my hope that this refference might help someone to learn this
> amazing writing system.
>
> Please look over the file with as a sample is only a couple hundred K
> in size and I would love to hear your comments. With just a little
> more work I will be ready to send it out in whole. Now being 10 MB in
> size that might be a problem but we can work that out later.
>
> Again please let me know you comments on this.
> Chuck
>
>
> To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> Read_Alphabet-unsubscribe@egroups.com
>
>
>
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service.

On Wednesday, December 11, 2002, at 08:10  AM, chuck091956
<<chuck091956@...> wrote:


<excerpt><fixed>Hello All,


I just uploaded to the Files section of the web site a "Orthodox

English Character Set to Quikscript Dictionary" It is only a sample

of the whole document and is still in draft form. The whole document

is 10 MB in size and is 1114 pages long.


The sourse for the translations\phonic pronunciations were derived by

Carnegie Mellon University. It was compiled in a machine-readable

pronunciation dictionary for standard North American English that

contains over 125,000 words. The dictionary uses a phoneme set of 39

phonemes, for which the vowels can carry lexical stress.


Carnegie Mellon University generated this dictionary using the

following independent sources:

- a 20k+ general English dictionary, built by hand at Carnegie Mellon

(extensively proofed and used).

- a 200k+ UCLA-proofed version of the shoup dictionary.

- a 32k subset of the Dragon dictionary.

- a 53k+ dictionary of proper names, synthesiser-generated, unproofed.

- a 200k dictionary generated with Orator, unproofed.

- a 200k dictionary generated with Mitalk, unproofed.


Its my hope that this refference might help someone to learn this

amazing writing system.


Please look over the file with as a sample is only a couple hundred K

in size and I would love to hear your comments. With just a little

more work I will be ready to send it out in whole. Now being 10 MB in

size that might be a problem but we can work that out later.


Again please let me know you comments on this.

Chuck
